instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with garbaged screen. It chimes and mouse works.

I created a linux usb with grub with these command:
   outb 0x728 1
   outb 0x710 2
   outb 0x740 2
   outb 0x750 0

and it went to a black screen and then shortly the screen is ok and allow me to boot up ubuntu graphic mode.. so the internal intel video works.

what should I do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
2850, already changed <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>.

I have just tried to set the nvram gpu-power-prefs and it behaves like 2915 that the garbage screen is gone and I saw white screen with flashing folder (i have no hdd installed).

So I guess this should confirmed that the mux is no problem but a bad GPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
Should be GPU then.
A hardware mod to disable it is already posted on the forum, I suppose.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
you mean remove <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR>? 

I actually tried to remove this before without the nvam var and the fan will start and stop cycling. 

Now that I have the nvram in place, let me try it again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
Also, it seems like the left speakers (the small one with the mic attached) doesnt work.. the chime sound came from the right speaker (attached together with subwoofer)

DZ6706 and <CAPACITOR>C6705</CAPACITOR> are missing..are they critical for the headphone? 

where do i start on this one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
Disabling GPU power supply is not sufficient; aka removing <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ufAIAy4l-0hktTASetlguznCdeldfqot/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Is already posted on some thread...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
Thanks!

However, upon more testing before I do that, I found out the screen would not come on sometime(still chime).. so perhaps the mux is bad afterall?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message: why would removing <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11 in <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> causes the fans to spin up and down in cycle but the same is unaffected in <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
Nobody mentioned this behaviour until now.
And I think few people did this mod on the forum.

Run HWMonitor and look for any strange temp.
Maybe GPU temp sensor is affected, when its power supply is stopped.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message:
HWMonitor cannot be run, as the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not boot up at all, fan just keep on spinning up and down. If you look into the mod files that you shared, you can find that the is no mention of cutting the GPU power, only soldering the lvds wires and backlight enable pins. 

It seems like the GPU power wasnt cut. Was this done in some other way?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A GPU issue
threads.message: I never dealt with GPU disable on 2850...
